djangotailoring.accounts.models¶

The only models that are built into djangotailoring.accounts are those necessary for tracking and managing Group Codes.

Models¶

class djangotailoring.accounts.models.GroupAccessCode¶

Instances of this Model define what are valid access codes for the current site.

groupcode¶

required A 30 character length string that is the code that users will use to access the site.

usage_limit¶

The ceiling for the number of uses this group code can have. A usage_limit less than zero indicates there is no limit.

code_class¶

Not a field Set to the djangotailoroing.accounts.accesscodes.Code class that is used to generate and validate new codes. By default this is set to djangotailoroing.accounts.accesscodes.Code.

generate_new_subcode(self)¶
Return type:a djangotailoroing.accounts.accesscodes.Code instance or None
Returns:a new Code object whose accesscode is listed in the GeneratedAccessCode class below. If the number of GeneratedAccessCode’s for this GroupAccessCode is greater than usage_limit, then None.

Note

If a Code instance is returned, the associated User object is not yet created.

class djangotailoring.accounts.models.GeneratedAccessCode¶

Provides a simple storage bucket for the codes generated by GroupAccessCode.

accesscode¶

The generated access code.

groupcode¶

A foreign-key reference to the generator class.

class djangotailoring.accounts.models.BasicGroupAccessCode¶

A proxy class of GroupAccessCode that set the code_class attribute to djangotailoring.accounts.accesscodes.BasicAccessCode.
